contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Belgium Municipality |name=Jemeppe-sur-Sambre |picture=Balâtre JPG02a.jpg |picture-legend=Balâtre Castle |map=Jemeppe-sur-Sambre Namur Belgium Map.png |map-legend=Location of Jemeppe-sur-Sambre in the province of Namur |arms=Blason de Jemeppe.svg |flag= |region={{BE-REG-WAL}} |community={{BE-FR}} |province={{BE-PROV-NM}} |arrondissement=[[Arrondissement of Namur|Namur]] |nis=92140 |pyramid-date |0-19= |20-64 |65 |foreigners= |foreigners-date |mayor=Stéphanie Thoron |majority=[[Mouvement Réformateur|MR]] - [[cdH]] - [[Ecolo]] - SEL |postal-codes=5190 |telephone-area=071 |web=[http://www.jemeppe-sur-sambre.be/ www.jemeppe-sur-sambre.be] |lat_deg=50 |lat_min=28 |lon_deg=04 |lon_min=40 }} '''Jemeppe-sur-Sambre''' ({{IPA-fr|ʒə.mɛp.syʁ.sɑ̃bʁ|lang}}) is a [[Wallonia|Walloon]] [[municipality]] located in the [[Belgium|Belgian]] province of [[Namur (province)|Namur]]. On 1 January 2006 the municipality had 17,990 inhabitants. The total area is 46.80 km², giving a [[population density]] of 384 inhabitants per km². Apart from the village of Jemeppe-sur-Sambre itself, the municipality contains the localities of Ham-sur-Sambre, Moustier-sur-Sambre, Spy, Mornimont, Balâtre, Onoz et Saint-Martin. The [[Grotte de Spy]] is located in the municipality near the village of [[Spy, Belgium|Spy]]. The medieval Balâtre Castle is in the village of Balâtre, and Mielmont Castle in Onoz. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.jemeppe-sur-sambre.be/francais/accueil.html Official website] (in French) {{commonscat}} {{Namur}} [[Category:Populated places in Belgium]] [[Category:Municipalities of Namur (province)]] {{Namur-geo-stub}}
